bug.short_desc: Headers in forwarded message credits in opposite order
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
a) Forwarding any email inverts the order of the email header to:
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Date: Sun, 09 Oct 2016 13:07:55 +0000 Subject: [Bug 1375645] Evolution is inserting Non-breaking space instead of Space at the start of lines even with "Preformatted" set To: harshula@redhat.com From: bugzilla@redhat.com https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1375645
b) There's no space/separation between the email header and the email content.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
* Fedora 25 * evolution-3.22.3-2.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible:
* Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Pick an email and press forward.
Actual results:
Date: Sun, 09 Oct 2016 13:07:55 +0000 Subject: [Bug 1375645] Evolution is inserting Non-breaking space instead of Space at the start of lines even with "Preformatted" set To: harshula@redhat.com From: bugzilla@redhat.com
Expected results:
From: bugzilla@redhat.com To: harshula@redhat.com Subject: [Bug 1375645] Evolution is inserting Non-breaking space instead of Space at the start of lines even with "Preformatted" set Date: Sun, 09 Oct 2016 13:07:55 +0000

Thanks for a bug report. I found out that this had been caused by this commit: https://git.gnome.org/browse/evolution/commit/?id=adcbacd46ee1367cb962acc45fa3b Pity you didn't report it before yesterday, when the 3.22.4 had been released.
